DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this prospective follow-up study is to investigate 5-year clinical outcome in patients with ST-elevation myocardial infarction undergoing remote ischemic conditioning before primary percutaneous coronary intervention.
DOC.brief_title: Long-term Clinical Outcome in Patients Undergoing Remote Ischemic Conditioning Before Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention for ST-elevation Myocardial Infarction: a Follow-up Study
DOC.criteria: Chest pain before admission to hospital within 12 h of onset, STsegment elevation of > 0,1 mV in 2 or more contiguous leads, 18 years or older. left bundle branch block, previous myocardial infarction, fibrinolytic treatment in the previous 30 days, previous coronary bypass surgery, left main stem stenosis requiring coronary bypass surgery, severe heart failure requiring mechanical ventilation or use of an intraaortic balloon pump.
